task.title: Use a New DITA Open Toolkit in

context.p: comes bundled with a DITA Open Toolkit, located in the [Oxygen-install-folder]/frameworks/dita/DITA-OT directory. To use a new DITA Open Toolkit, follow these steps:

step.cmd: Edit your transformation scenarios and in the Parameters tab change the value for the dita.dir directory to point to the new directory.

To make changes in the libraries that come with the new DITA Open Toolkit and are used by the ANT process, go to the Advanced tab, click the Libraries button and uncheck Allow Oxygen to add high priority libraries to classpath.

If there are also changes in the DTD's and you want to use the new versions for content completion and validation, go to the preferences in the Document Type Association page, edit the DITA and DITA Map document types and modify the catalog entry in the Catalogs tab to point to the custom catalog file catalog-dita.xml.
